III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/10/23, unknown staff punched youth in the face, threw youth
on the ground and continued to punch youth on the chest and ribs
with a closed fist. This happened behind a dumpster outside the
facility. Youth had red marks on face and body from the incident.
Investigation This complaint was assigned on 06/12/2023 and investigated in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist.
I interviewed the complainant via telephone on 06/12/2023 and
they reported no further information.
I interviewed Director on 06/13/2023 at the facility, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Director reported he saw Youth A
yesterday and he did not see any bruises or marks on him, and
Youth A did not express any concerns regarding staff. There were
several youths that AWOLed this past weekend. He said Youth A
does have a history of AWOLing.
I interviewed Youth A on 06/13/2023 at the facility, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the facility for one
year. Youth A said he AWOLed from campus on 06/10/2023 and
went to Kinlock Park. He went to the park to meet up with his
friend from school, but the park was closed so he came back to
campus. He said Staff 3 was following him and he was only gone
for 5 minutes. Youth A denied being punched, hit, or thrown to the
ground by Staff. Youth A said he feels safe and has no
issues/concerns regarding staff or the facility. Youth A also denied
having any bruises or injuries.
I interviewed Youth B on 06/13/2023 at the facility, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B has been at the facility for 9
months. Youth B was playing video games on 06/10/2023 and the
rest of the boys were outside playing basketball. He denied
witnessing staff hit or punch Youth A. He said there were three
2

staff members working that evening. Youth B expressed no
concerns regarding any of the staff members working that
evening.
I interviewed Youth C on 06/13/2023 at the facility in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C has been at the facility for 5
years. Youth C reported when he gets in trouble at the facility staff
will redirect or take away privileges like video games. Youth C
said on 06/10/2023 he went with staff to pick up pizza. He denied
witnessing staff hit or punch Youth A. Youth C reported feeling
safe and expressed no concerns regarding staff.
I interviewed Youth D on 06/13/2023 at the facility, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth D denied witnessing Staff hit or
punch Youth A. Youth D denied fighting with Youth A and denied
using a vape or having Youth A buy him a vape. Youth D reported
feeling safe and did not express any concerns regarding staff.
I interviewed Youth E on 06/13/2023 at the facility, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth E reported he AWOLed on
06/10/2023 and walked around campus. He denied arguing or
fighting with Youth A. Youth E said there were three staff
members supervising. Youth E denied witnessing Staff hit or
punch Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 06/13/2023 via telephone, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 confirmed she was working on
06/10/2023. Staff 1 has been working at the facility for 5 years.
She reported on 06/10/2023, she was inside the cottage and Staff
2 was outside with Youth A. She said Youth A AWOLed, but she
is not sure how long he was gone. When Youth A returned to the
cottage he did not appear to be upset, but he did argue with staff.
She denied anything physical occurred with Youth A and staff.
I interviewed Staff 2 on 06/13/2023 at the facility, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 has been working at the facility for
8 months as a Youth Specialist. He reported on 06/10/2023, Youth
A took off running and he followed him. He said Youth A came
back to campus with another boy from the neighborhood. He
thinks that Youth A knows the boy from school. Youth A was upset
and was arguing with Youth D and E from the campus, who
accused Youth A of taking their money to buy a vape. He was
able to deescalate the situation and got Youth A to go back to the
cottage. Youth A did not have a vape or anything else on him. He
denied any physical altercation occurred between the youths. He
further denied hitting or punching Youth A.
3

I interviewed Staff 3 on 06/30/2023 via telephone, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 reported on 06/10/2023, he was
outside with the youths and Staff 2. He said Youth A AWOLed on
06/10/2023 and Staff 2 followed him. Youth A returned to campus
a few minutes later. He denied witnessing Staff punch or hit any of
Youth A. He said Youth A is the one that usually starts arguing
and trying to fight with Staff and that staff will redirect and try to
deescalate the situation. Staff 3 has a good relationship with
Youth A and if something happened Youth A would immediately
report it to him.
DHHS Specialist Predisposition conference held on 07/13/2023
with MDHHS Specialist and Supervisor. There are no findings by
DHHS Specialist.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated 06/10/2023, written by Staff 2. Youth
A AWOLed at 8:25 pm and returned to campus at 8:30 pm.
• Medical assessment for Youth A, dated 06/13/2023, Youth
A was examined by Nurse on Campus. Youth A reported
no issues, no aches or pains, no headaches, or recent
injures. A body check was completed. He had no visible
injuries. No redness or bruises around neck, arms.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is no evidence that
Youth A was punched or hit by staff, based on interviews with staff,
youths, and documentation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
